website_summaries.verdict: Gorgeously rendered mythical world propelled by an intimate story and quality gameplay.
pros: Emotionally intense and exhilarating father and son tale expertly voiced and written
Requires more strategy than previous, button-smashing iterations
Stunning settings and smart AI make gameplay challenging
cons: Higher difficulty requires more attention and strategy
may be a struggle for some players
More thoughtful and slower paced at times

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: This is a fun game. Very engrossing. I wish people wouldn’t rate it based on whether they received a digital code or not. It has nothing to do with game play and so is very misleading. Take it up with Amazon but don’t criticize the game because you’re upset.
customer_reviews.author: Markb

customer_reviews.title: God of War has triumphantly returned !!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a masterpiece of gaming one of the best games I have ever played 🤘🤘
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Harper

customer_reviews.title: Boring and not well made
customer_reviews.text: Kept trying to get into the game, but it really just sucked. Combat is very limited. The story line isn't engaging at all. After trying to put in about 4-5 hours I put it aside because I was bored and frustrated. Plenty of other better games out there.
customer_reviews.author: feak

customer_reviews.title: This isn’t God if War. It’s a Last of us type game.
customer_reviews.text: I mean this isn’t God of War. The play mechanics are so odd and poor that I had to stop plying the game and then come back to it with a mindset that this is like a Last of us type game with god of war like mythology. That mindset shift helped a lot. I also took the difficulty way down so I could just watch this movie in peace. With its bad fight mechanics, it is just a pain to try to play at higher difficulties. I was disappointed overall as a god of war fan but as a last of us fan, this is a good storytelling type game to sit and watch/ play a bit.
customer_reviews.author: Aman

customer_reviews.title: Hands down must play.
customer_reviews.text: I've played the first three god of war's and the psp versions, but this game right here is by far the best game i have ever played addicted straight from the start. Every night i play as much as i possibly can before i realize i am a adult an have work in the morning, brings back so many memory's but 11 out of 10.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Worth the wait!!!
customer_reviews.text: This game was preordered for my husband, it’s amazing. I’m sorry to those of you who code “didn’t work” but that doesn’t mean you give the product a lower rating, common sense. I highly recommend this game. I’d give it more stars if able to.
customer_reviews.author: Warnali

customer_reviews.title: It's not as good as 2 and 3
customer_reviews.text: I'm sorry but 2 and 3 were better. This is meh. At first its like oh wow. And then it becomes repetitive. The puzzles are no wayas good and the fighting is meh with unspectacular boss fights. I bought a ps4 for this game because of 2 and 3. Ends up that the remakes of the last of us (Loved that game) and GOW3 got played through with joy as I have not returned to this game. Its not a bad game. Just blah and boring.
customer_reviews.author: Daddy Fix It

customer_reviews.title: I don’t get it.
customer_reviews.text: Not the god of war I was used to or hoping for. Plays incredibly clunky and slow. I have no idea what the hype was about. I got bored very quickly and resold this in a couple of days
customer_reviews.author: LBD429

customer_reviews.title: I hate the mechanics of this game...
customer_reviews.text: This game has an issue at least for me, a very old man. It is hard to see even in a 55" 4K TV where I could see the a very tiny cursor on the screen to help me fight the battles. I played all the other "God of War" games, but I was unable to play it at all even though lots people praise this game, for it does look fantastic on the screen. I guess it is not a game for 65+ year old people like myself.
customer_reviews.author: O. Dago

customer_reviews.title: The Return of Kratos
customer_reviews.text: Oh my God of War this is certainly the PS4's greatest game to date. I've only played maybe 8 hours of it but even that short time was enough to net a 5-star rating. It's different from the older games but in a good way. The combat is more methodical and the Norse mythology is represented incredibly well. Santa Monica also outdid themselves with the graphics; if you have a HDR television you are in for a real treat.
customer_reviews.author: dstamandone

customer_reviews.title: Slow
customer_reviews.text: Slow almost as bad as horizon. Don't get why people enjoy these type of games.
customer_reviews.author: Steven  Hannestad

customer_reviews.title: the character development excellent and graphics superb
customer_reviews.text: I usually wait until I've finished a game, but this one warranted an early review. I bought GoW because of the hype mostly - I generally prefer RPG's with heavier storyline than the hack-n-slash games offer, and have shied away from the GoW series because of that. That said, this game is a masterpiece! The combat system is smooth, the character development excellent and graphics superb. There is a surprise behind every corner. The story does take a back seat to combat, as expected in GoW, but it is still extremely well done. The developing relationship between father and son, with surprise twists and turns in the plot to keep things exciting. This one is already a classic.
customer_reviews.author: M. M.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I have been a fan of this series from the beginning so I couldn’t wait for this game ticket come out. While there were some changes to the game play mechanics at its heart it is still the satisfying, button mashing, puzzle solving, overall great experience the last games have been. There is plenty of side quests and missions to keep you busy for hours. If you were a fan of the games on previous consoles or if you are interested in a addictively fun, beautifully rendered game with a rich story I would highly recommend this game. 5 stars just isn’t enough!
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Get ready to have your socks blown off!  God of War better than ever before!
customer_reviews.text: What can I say? God of War at it absolute BEST! I've played all the games up to this one and loved them all. This one is so awesome, there are no adequate words to express how much fun playing the game is. One of the best parts is that it is open world so you can go here, there and everywhere at will without being forced to follow a particular thread or direction. The challenges and fights are engaging and the weapons, armor and skills selections are boundless! Totally worth the price and I am VERY HAPPY I bought it!
customer_reviews.author: MsPurrple

customer_reviews.title: Great buy at $20, Good Kratos.
customer_reviews.text: *At this time I have not finished the game*. That being said I have played for a few hours and have much experience with the first three titles. Whether you are a fan of the series or have not played any I can assure you that purchasing any of the main God of War titles for $20 is never a bad idea. This one is no different in that regard and boast crossover appeal for multiple genres along with new series dynamic. Every Sony believer should experience this title along with the others and personally it's a deal at $20, or $30 or $40 etc.. Happy Hunting.
customer_reviews.author: ProfessorWho

customer_reviews.title: Personally did not enjoy the game
customer_reviews.text: I did not enjoy this game. It is not like the games I normally like (open world RPGs), but thought with the good reviews I would give it a try. Bit disapointed I only played about 30 minutes before putting it away (likely for good).
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Zelda meets Darksiders
customer_reviews.text: I bought a PS4 instead of an Xbox One just so I could play this game. Because I loved the Darksiders series and read tons of reviews about the hack n slash raves about GOW I bought it and am not dissapointed in the least. It's a beautiful game in terms of combat, graphics, and challenge. I love how you can switch between throwing your axe, arrows (your son) and punching. Good puzzles, decimating powerful enemies and hunting for upgrades to add onto your arsenal. Caution: there is some strong language when you meet the small blue dwarf and early on it's quite bloody when fighting the stranger. Overall a wonderfully crafted game.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Kinghorn

customer_reviews.title: Just not for me as a hardcore god of war fan.
customer_reviews.text: Gameplay wise it is solid and graphics are amazing but it's just strayed too far from what I consider god of war and for that I didn't finish it.
customer_reviews.author: Moneylover

customer_reviews.title: So good. Seriously so good
customer_reviews.text: It's more linear than I like in video games. I'm a big fan of open world games but this sort of felt like an open world even though it's pretty linear. The boss fights are super hard and I hate boss fights. The nice thing for me is they are completely optional. If you like boss fights it's a great challenge and if you don't like them, you can still finish the game without going through them.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Holman

customer_reviews.title: Best God of War?
customer_reviews.text: This game is awesome. Very different from the previous ones but in all the best ways. Better puzzles, better fighting system, and literally the most immersive graphics I've seen on PS4 Pro yet. The game takes place within Norse mythology and brings many new features to the title like a fleshed-out skill tree, armor/weapon/item crafting, open world elements, and a companion (your son). While some classic God of War things stay the same, like level-shifting puzzles, brutal kill scenes, an emotional story of mythological proportions, and Kratos being a stone cold God-killer. Favorite game of 2018 followed by Spider-Man.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Gameplay much different from earlier releases.
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately this is not really a continuation of the GOW series with a total departure from the gameplay I was looking to carry forward from the earlier releases. Much of the action is simply button pressing with little skill required from the player. In places it seems less like a game and more like a movie.
customer_reviews.author: Mistercraig

customer_reviews.title: Most best game ever!
customer_reviews.text: I love this game and i pre-ordered the game this year and played it. Still going full 100% but i enjoyed the game so much but i don't give it a 10/10 but mostly for me i give the game 9.7/10. mostly the trolls been mostly the bosses and just reskin and overall just felt more lack of enemies for bosses but great game to pick up, anyone who is a completionist or a casual game do pick this game up. Also nice to see a God of War game at least one of them have a winning title of Game of the Year. Super awesome job Santa Monica Studios!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Putnal

customer_reviews.title: Must play
customer_reviews.text: These is one of the most intense games I've ever played. I am new to GOW games and this one pulled me in none the less. At less than 20$ it provides probably 50+ hours of an immersive, visually stunning adventure. At one point during combat I had to hit pause and do some breathing exercises... very few games have had this effect on me. ME3 at times and this one achieved a different level of war and combat in many ways.
customer_reviews.author: Jaredz

customer_reviews.title: I know I’m one of the few...
customer_reviews.text: The product itself was in good condition. I’m just one of the few people who didn’t like the game. It felt short and anticlimactic. You work the whole game to get somewhere and when you finally do, the storyline is over for the game. I do love Norse mythology though. I enjoyed that part.
customer_reviews.author: MD

customer_reviews.title: Meh...
customer_reviews.text: Maybe interesting things will come later on, maybe I'm not a father nor a son, maybe the norse theme has been beaten into the ground too much but it's actually quite boring for me.
customer_reviews.author: Kyryll

customer_reviews.title: Close to perfect as can be!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent gaming experience that is highly engrossing. Definitely solid 50-60 hours to platinum and, like the previous entries, can be very punishing for mistakes. Finishing the story is great but I found the bigger challenge was defeating the Valkyries and finding the right combination of weapons/powers to keep Kratos alive. The interaction between him and his son resonates well and this game has brought the single player experience to a level that's been missed for quite some time.
customer_reviews.author: RoKiTo

customer_reviews.title: A Great Addition to the God of War series
customer_reviews.text: This game is a real delight, as Kratos moves to the Norse side of mythology and finds himself raising his son in an unforgiving setting. Incredible animation and a great story, it's still pretty violent but that's leavened by the presence of his young son. Lots of amazing sequences and fanciful settings. One minor glitch near the end was annoying, but other than that it's a terrific game.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck Minsker

customer_reviews.title: Very fun game
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't stop playing this game once I started. The game is very addicting with a great story line. The controls are great too. I do have one complaint. The valkyrie boss is tough, even on the easiest game mode setting she still kills me easily. Lower her difficulty level and the game is perfect. I gave 5 stars still though because me sucking at the game, shouldn't be a ding on the rating. I can't wait for the next GoW series to come out. Buy this game, you won't regret it!
customer_reviews.author: Tan Pham

customer_reviews.title: A reason to own the PS4 (on top of like 15 or so other reasons
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful, heartfelt, violent, tragic and redeeming. I skipped the God of War franchise up to this entry. Seemed like too much violence without a lot of heart, but I always thought the aesthetics were pretty awesome. After seeing the early reviews and gameplay I added this to the very short list of games I've preordered. Beat it after a few weeks, and months later I'm still thinking about it. That first fight with Baldur... the world snake... Freya... And Atreus's potential fate... Wow! This game has so much heart and depth I'm still blown away. It might become one of the rare games I return to for a replay.
customer_reviews.author: SpaceDesigner

customer_reviews.title: Epic
customer_reviews.text: I've played these titles since they first released. The first games were obvious, thin on plot and long on majesty. Big imagery and lots of gruesome violence. This game is far better. It's filled out (much like kratos) and is far better for it. You never really knew the good of war too you meet him as a husband and a father. It's absolutely legendary.
customer_reviews.author: StephenG.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing game.  No micro transactions/gambling.
customer_reviews.text: Amazing game with amazing graphics, gameplay and story. It’s full of secrets and things to discover. The witches house looks really cool and creative. A lot of cool things to see in this game. And it’s one of a few major AAA games today without all the micro transactions and illegal gambling for children for (like EA games). This game is actually worth its full price.
customer_reviews.author: AP

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: This is a great game for both fans of the God of War series and newcomers alike. It’s a little bit more subdued than the original trilogy, but keeps a lot of the elements that made those games great. The graphics are stunning, the atmosphere is breathtaking, and the whole experience is extremely cinematic. I love the story, the gameplay, and the characters. There is also quite a bit of substance to the game; I never got bored or ran out of things to do. I’ve put in about 50 hours and will likely pick it up and start all over again a year from now. It’s pure entertainment.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Arrived sealed in plastic wrap. Received in a very timely manner. I will definitely order from seller again!! I got "God of War "PS4. I luv G.O.W. games period!! This one adds to the kickArse gameplay of originals but a lil different from other God of War games but a good thing.Great story line, this game can go in so many directions it's great! The price wasn't too over the top either. I prefer this over GameStop used, any day! Thx Amazon,..
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: "VERY FUN AND ADDICTIVE"
customer_reviews.text: The return of the furious Spartan warrior was made well, loaded with action and is easily one of the best games of this generation. I have not had this much fun playing video games in a very long time. The combat is perfect and you are always unlocking new moves and the story has kept me extremely interested the whole way through there is many twists and turns and it all equals out to an unforgettable experience.
customer_reviews.author: HAROLD

customer_reviews.title: Best game of this console generation
customer_reviews.text: Visceral combat, mind blowing graphics, characters and story telling to care about, all with high production values and polish. It feels like Bloodborne, Horizon Zero Dawn, and Uncharted had a baby and then that baby grew up to murder the Greek pantheon and assume the mantle of the God of War. This game is a masterpiece.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Game
customer_reviews.text: Great game but pretty hard. Unfortunately, there is no choice of setting (easy, normal, hard), but it is beautiful to look at. At least you have great scenery while you struggle to kill the bigger monsters. Also, the game looks like it would be a sand box type but sadly it isn't. However, it's a lot of fun and, of course, all those players who are probably a lot better than I am may not have any trouble at all with those huge monsters.
customer_reviews.author: Hawaii Girl

customer_reviews.title: A must own single player game!
customer_reviews.text: Simply one of the best single player gamesin ages with combat ranging from fun and part of an amazing and immersive story to more difficult than I can manage even on simple encounters (for now). This is the first God of War game where I definitely felt like I was a god. Very immersive and your son, Atreus, is more help than any hindrance.
customer_reviews.author: Noptraptor

customer_reviews.title: Amazing game! One of the best games out there
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely loved this game. It was awesome. The story was really cool and kept me interested the entire time. The characters are well developed and this chapter introduces you to a whole new world. The thing I loved the most was the new axe weapon. I loved throwing that thing around making you feel like an even better Thor. I'll definitely go back and play again one day. You won't regret playing this game.
customer_reviews.author: Gerardo Gamboa

customer_reviews.title: What GOW fans need to know!
customer_reviews.text: This deserves to be said for those of us who are disappointed with Kratos using an axe. In the middle of the game Kratos acquires the BLADES OF CHAOS,and he is restored to his former awesomeness. People need to know that the blades are not gone and Kratos looks absolutely stunning using them.
customer_reviews.author: Eternal

customer_reviews.title: Unbelievable graphics!
customer_reviews.text: Great story, perfect graphics, Santa Monica nailed it this time.
customer_reviews.author: Tejas Kulkarni

customer_reviews.title: One of the Best
customer_reviews.text: I'm an Xbox fan first and foremost. I finally decided to buy a PS4 to catch up on some of the games that were supposed to be amazing. At the top of the list was God of War. This game is as good as everyone says it is. Great gameplay, graphics, and most importantly a great story. Easy 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: TD

customer_reviews.title: One of the best games from playstation
customer_reviews.text: So i purchased this game because I liked the reviews and thought i would give it a shot and boy did i get this one right. Graphics are amazing gameplay is from moderate to hard just because some of the giant monster you have to fight and beat just to get to the next level. I like the story and will recommend this to anyone who loves action games like this one.
customer_reviews.author: Matt. G

customer_reviews.title: Absolute Banger
customer_reviews.text: Big fan of Norse mythology and the team over at Santa Monica Studio absolutely nailed it in this game. I had zero experience with God of War prior to this game, so I can’t speak to how it compares to the other games in the series. However, on its own, this game stands tall. It perfectly blends combat, exploration, and story. Genuinely one of the best paced games I’ve played in recent years. The second I would think, “okay, I’m ready for some story”, BOOM there would be another chapter to the story. I cannot recommend this game enough. If you like video games of any kind, I am confident that you have fun with this game.
customer_reviews.author: dearkyrin

customer_reviews.title: A very awesome game.
customer_reviews.text: This game is truly amazing. I've played and beat God of War 1,2, and 3. This game most definitely blows them all out of the water. If you have played the previous games or even if you haven't this game is still worth owning. A great story, amazing graphics, amazing sound, amazing game play. It deserves to be nominated for the Game of The Year Award.
customer_reviews.author: The Techman

customer_reviews.title: Too damn hard.
customer_reviews.text: Disclaimer: Casual gamer. Too damn hard. Couldn’t pass a point not even halfway through the game. Beautiful rendering, but not really “open world.” And if it’s “story” you’re after, invest in History’s Vikings instead.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Absolute masterpiece
customer_reviews.text: Amazing story, beautiful graphics, tons of quests to do, and fun characters make this game a 5/5 masterpiece for me. I loved playing through a new take on Kratos. The introduction of a slower combat system made each attack feel substantial and visceral. My recommendation: Play through the story once, then go back and do sidequests and other events. You won't miss out on much and you will be better prepared to take on some of the toughest side bosses.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan L.

customer_reviews.title: Simply excellent
customer_reviews.text: One of the best games I've ever played. If you enjoy engaging, story-driven games with strong characters, this one is as immersive and deep as you could want. Add to that the amazing exploration of Norse mythology and a fantastic musical score, this game provides hours of solid entertainment.
customer_reviews.author: Aethelbran

customer_reviews.title: If you are coming from The Witcher 3, HZD, you are going to LOVE THIS.
customer_reviews.text: I have always been an X-Box owner but I wanted to play The Last of Us so bad that last year I bought the PS4 for their remastered edition. Since then I have played The Witcher 3, Horizon Zero Dawn, and now my latest obessison God of War. I am speechless at the quality of these games, the stories they tell. Good job on making story focused games in a way that a 30+ year old adult can enjoy them without hesitation.
customer_reviews.author: Sammy

customer_reviews.title: Amazing take on the franchise
customer_reviews.text: Really well made and great story with fun mechanics. Though replay-ability for me is lacking. Maybe Santa Monica will surprise us with some extras down the road before the next installment.
customer_reviews.author: Paulo

customer_reviews.title: WOW WOW WOW
customer_reviews.text: WOW..... REALLY?.... WOW.... Arrived yesterday and I started playing as soon as I got it. Only played for about an hour and just WOW. Did I say WOW, yet? WOW. Awesome graphics, awesome game play and the story line is perfect so far. It's gonna take a while (obviously) to get to know it all, but if the rest of the game is like my first hour, then WOW. Please get it if you are a true GOW geek like me. Loving it. I'd give it 10 stars if I could
customer_reviews.author: Bak9

customer_reviews.title: It's literally god of war, but norse
customer_reviews.text: What can I say, the legend returns!? This game was present a lot in my childhood so I enjoyed the heck out of it. Definitely prefer Greek Mythology to Norse, but hey it's still mega fun! A lot more details were added this time around so you have to be a bit more involved in the game to get the max out of it!
customer_reviews.author: austin

customer_reviews.title: Father and son masterpiece tale
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to play on the upcoming ps5 next year. I've been a fan of the series since I played it on the ps3. God of War III is my fave ps3 game of all time so of course I would make the reboot my very first game for the ps5 since it will have backward compatibility.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent Roberson Jr

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Last of Us with more awesome actions, and a slightly more broken and emotionally stunt main character.
customer_reviews.author: KH

customer_reviews.title: Bought as a gift for the boyfriend
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my bf for Christmas. He started playing it after the first of the year and he beat the game...probably by March. He played it about one night a week and at least once a weekend. I wish it would have taken him longer to play. I actually kind of enjoyed watching him play it. Great graphics and story line.
customer_reviews.author: SarahMonroe

customer_reviews.title: Open world, cut scenes ad nausium, but still amazing
customer_reviews.text: Ok, its gow and yes i gave it 4 stars because of the cut scenes. It became laborous and because you cant skip them it is doubtful i will play it again. Its also akin to an open world c setting, which was fine. The story was immerseful and the graphics stunning. I like how you dont have to get carpul tunnel from mashing buttons anymore. Its God of War.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: The Graphics! WOW! Cussing...not for littles!
customer_reviews.text: I was blown away by the graphics and loved the storyline. The fights were hard, bosses or otherwise! Lots of ways to customize weapons and upgrade skills. Truly a wuality game. Gory! Only complaint is the cuss words, which were often put in just to be there, perhaps for shock value? Seemed over the top. Anyway, great game overall!
customer_reviews.author: janak23in

customer_reviews.title: Fun and kept me engaged.
customer_reviews.text: The gameplay was surprisingly fun and interesting, I usually get bored with video games but God of War kept me engaged and interested with its great story and stunning graphics. I didn’t dislike any part of the game and it took me about 2 weeks to beat it, which i like because short gameplay feels like a waste of money. Overall great game I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Otto Weirich

customer_reviews.title: MUST BUY THIS GAME!!!
customer_reviews.text: WOW what an amazing game! Recently beat it and I am sad it is over. I will continue playing it so that I can get that 100% because this game is so fun all I want to do it play it. A MUST buy for PS4 owners. Amazing storytelling and graphics and the combat is just flawless. It might seem hard at first with all the combos you can do but you will pick it up quick and be reacting and throwing combos lightning fast.
customer_reviews.author: David Moreno

customer_reviews.title: 4.5 instead of 5
customer_reviews.text: THE COMBAT WAS GREAT IN MY OPINION! ... but ... I would give it 4.5 out of 5, because it's not perfect. The first playthrough was absolutely awesome. Picking up all of the collectibles in the second playthrough is tedious though, and you need to pick up the collectibles in order to become stronger. Collecting everything for the first time was VERY fun and exciting, but it gets old and boring after the first playthrough.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon M.

customer_reviews.title: Combat/controls
customer_reviews.text: Combat/controls are awful. I tried using ‘classic’ controls but those felt even worse.
customer_reviews.author: Sourshoes

customer_reviews.title: Great game and graphics
customer_reviews.text: Great game and graphics. It looks amazing on a PS4 Pro. A game with a wonderful story-line, and just awesomely insane fights. I played it everyday till the end. I would say on normal difficulty, it took about 45 hours. But I went looking for all the hidden areas and loot, and took side quests as well, which you really should do. Playing the main mission only, is just not fulfilling.
customer_reviews.author: Maximus

customer_reviews.title: One of the best games I’ve ever played
customer_reviews.text: This is like a combination of God of War and The Last of Us. This game did a lot of things right (story, world building, relationship between father and son, graphics, side quests, progression, and exploration). Nothing feels like a chore to me because I found enjoyment in exploration and finding rare treasure at the end of the endeavor. I didn’t think they could pull this game off because I really thought Kratos’s story should have ended after God of War 3. It could have been an ending. I’m glad I was wrong and these other 5 star reviews are not lying. This is genuinely an excellent game!
customer_reviews.author: John C

customer_reviews.title: Santa Monica did a really great job with this game
customer_reviews.text: Santa Monica did a really great job with this game, I've never played a god of war game before this and I can easily say this has sparked my interest in the rest of the series. This is how games were meant to be developed. You can seriously see the time and effort that was put into this game from the combat mechanics, and sound design. Graphically, this game is a masterpiece running on today's technology.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Oro

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: Mechanics are great. The way the game is set up requires you to explore hard if you want to upgrade and stand a chance against strong enemies. As you get new abilities you have to backtrack to previously explored areas to get into a chest you previously couldn’t which was a bit annoying but not the end of the world. Beautiful game.
customer_reviews.author: Springer Dinger

customer_reviews.title: 5 STAR GAME, THE GAME OF THE YEAR!
customer_reviews.text: THIS GAME IS AMAZING, IT IS FOR EVERYONE WHO WANTS THE BEST PLAYSTATION GAME MADE IN THE LAST YEAR, IT CAN BE HARD AT TIMES BUT THE STORY IS SIMPLY AMAZING, I WOULD RECOMMEND THIS TOO ANYONE WHO HAS A PLAYSTATION 4 HANDS DOWN A WORK OF ART, AMAZING GAME.
customer_reviews.author: Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Love the new series direction
customer_reviews.text: I played all of the God of Wars minus the one for PS3. I'd just replayed Horizon: Zero Dawn before this and it was a great transition. Tons of exploration and beautiful realms to explore. A fun, touching story that leaves me wanting more. It did end a bit abruptly, I thought, but I expect a sequel :)
customer_reviews.author: April

customer_reviews.title: Good game
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband. It has great graphics and unique looking characters. That’s about all I can comment on since I lost interest after that. He, however, was so engrossed he couldn’t comment, so that means it’s a good game. Maybe not for the wives who want attention though.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Quenga

customer_reviews.title: The Best Game Ever (After Bloodborne)
customer_reviews.text: The story is magnificent, the game play is over the top, and the direction of this franchise has taken a better direction. Thank you for making an amazing game without sexuality of women. I hope Rockstar can learn from this, and I look forward to the next God Of War on the PS5.
customer_reviews.author: Mexyrian

customer_reviews.title: God of War
customer_reviews.text: I gave this game three stars because of the glitches in the game I couldn't finish all of the assingments due to the glitches. I like to finish games I play and I couldn't finish this one, other than that I liked the game.
customer_reviews.author: Rayjay

customer_reviews.title: GOTY for a reason!
customer_reviews.text: If you like a thrilling story, amazing graphics, bone crushing combat and memorable characters then this is the game for you! God of War PS4 is great for a thousand reasons and more. I want to write an extensive review about all the things I enjoyed about this game but I think it's better if you just play it. There's a reason this game got so many Game of the year awards. I want more!
customer_reviews.author: Jared

customer_reviews.title: I loved this game so much
customer_reviews.text: This game was honestly the best game I've ever played, with the exception of The Last of Us. The graphics were great, with a small exception for water. The soundtrack was amazing and the storyline is so beautiful. I literally cried when I finished this game because I loved the ending and story so much but also because it was over and I want mooooore
customer_reviews.author: Danee

customer_reviews.title: Best GOW game since the first
customer_reviews.text: This game did a lot of things right. Outside of the first one, it was my favorite. I thought the boy would be a bother, but he added a lot of humor and helped in battles. Pros: Graphics Storyline Fight sequences Length Great puzzles Cons: Wasn't longer
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: A- Game Very Good But Little Overrated.
customer_reviews.text: i was Expecting Little more Epic Enemies/battles overall for game with such a high Rating, overall This is Really Very Good Game but i think while it is great in 2018-2019 it will be only Average/good in 2020-2021... for comparison people are still playing Skyrim after 7-8 years while i almost sure that very tiny amount will play God of war 2018 after 3-4 years.

customer_reviews.title: Must buy for any PS4 owner
customer_reviews.text: A refreshing single-player experience. Biggest flaws are the tiny font in the menus and the inability to fast travel until late in the game. The difficulty can go either way for a gamer, and this is a difficult game, but you have ample opportunity to explore in order to get better gear and you organically adapt to the combat system. You actually feel accomplished when defeating a bout of enemies or a boss.
customer_reviews.author: A buyer

customer_reviews.title: You won't be blown away with the story but you'll have a lot of fun!
customer_reviews.text: God of War is an 8 out of 10 for me. With this you're getting amazing combat and graphics, however the story is lacking. I recommend purchasing this game even if you haven't played any of the God of War series before. There is plenty to do after you finish the story so you'll definitely get the most out of it. Fun game!
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: You already know its worth it
customer_reviews.text: The game is amazing when it comes to graphics and you can customize certain things in the game but I am not giving away details of the story. The gameplay and character fluidness is pretty good. Warning if you do not like puzzles this game is not for you.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Eye Candy and Then Some
customer_reviews.text: The cliff hanger ending is a drag but the rest of the game is so riveting it makes up for it, not to mention the brutally satisfying combat. I also don't think I've ever seen a better looking game on a console.
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: Best game in a while
customer_reviews.text: Best God of War ever and best game I've played in a while. Definitely must play if you like sorta-open world sorta-RPG games with a great story and characters. The kid is annoying for a while, but you miss him when he goes silent and you have to use his skills in order to progress past the bosses and tougher challenges.
customer_reviews.author: Tan Gent

customer_reviews.title: Best PS game ever made
customer_reviews.text: If you like God of War games and wish they had more story and depth, this is the game for you. EASILY the best GoW game ever made and in my personal opinion, best Playstation game ever made (across all generations). It didn't win game of the year in every publication for no reason.
customer_reviews.author: Jason S

customer_reviews.title: Best singleplayer, story-based game to be released recently
customer_reviews.text: Best singleplayer, story-based game to be released recently. The seamless transitions between story development and gamplay lead to previously untapped levels of immersion. The story is intensely emotional and full of fantastic set pieces and coupled with awesome combat.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Best God of War Yet
customer_reviews.text: Just picked this up for a filler type of game as most of the prior God of War are pretty much hack and slash. This one on the other hand has more of a story line and is more immersive. Was glad to pick it up during prime day for only $15 definitely worth more than that. My only complaint is the fighting system was a little clunky to me at first, but I grew used to it pretty quickly.
customer_reviews.author: James L. Smith

customer_reviews.title: I loved every single minute of it
customer_reviews.text: This is a Masterpiece. I have not said that since Witcher 3. They've brought god of war to the next generation and it's glorious. Absolutely glorious. I loved every single minute of it! Buy it now. You won't regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Saunders

customer_reviews.title: Great game. Definitely one of the best this generation
customer_reviews.text: Great game. Is the most satisfying game of this generation. Gameplay is excellent and the graphics are next level. Is what games are supposed to be. Fun to play with great story and challenging to an extent. Not too long. But let’s wait for a new DLC to extent the story
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Juan Infante

customer_reviews.title: Gamers Must Play This
customer_reviews.text: Very well made game. Amazing story line. Kept me wanting to play more. Just when you think it's over... BAMM Plot twist on more than one occasion. Worth the money and will play it several times through. It never gets old.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick O'Quin

customer_reviews.title: Dad of Boi is STILL the best game on the PS4
customer_reviews.text: Yo, if you are considering buying this game at this point, just do it. ;) It's 2 years old so I scooped it up for 20 bucks, and it's definitely my favorite PS4 game so far. It's worth the full price of 60.
customer_reviews.author: Spencer

customer_reviews.title: Badass! 5/5
customer_reviews.text: You do not need to have played the previous games to enjoy this masterpiece. Everything from the music, graphics, storyline & gameplay is majestically executed. I find myself in awe in regards to the seamless cinematic-to-gameplay transitions and also incessantly challenged to beat each checkpoint. I am not a big PS4 fan, but I'm definitely going to retire my Xbox until I beat this game on the hardest difficulty. BEST GAME of 2018 SO FAR! MUST BUY!
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Alexandria

customer_reviews.title: The story is worth it
customer_reviews.text: The game is phenomenal!!!!! I loved every second of it. The best part about this game is the story. I was so involved in the story that I struggled to do anything else until I beat the game. I constantly had to know what was going to happen, where the story was going to go next and how we would get there!!!
customer_reviews.author: Harris072

customer_reviews.title: Boy! This game is good.
customer_reviews.text: If you're a fan of the old hack and slash Kratos then this might not be for you. It's a different combat system although. I like how it takes place in the Norse mythology. The story and graphics are really amazing and I'm looking forward to the sequels. The only part where it drags is grinding for armor to fight the Valkyrie Queen. That's completely optional of course.
customer_reviews.author: Chase

customer_reviews.title: Top 5 RPG of all time!
customer_reviews.text: One of the best RPG games I've ever played! The story is phenomenal and the combat mechanics are just as good. Even though it's not quite an open-world game, the map feels enormous and each new area is exciting to visit because they are all so unique. The only negative I can think of is that there are a few 'bosses' that are simply reskins of other enemies with the same combat mechanics. Despite this, I still had so much fun throughout my entire play-through. I can't recommend this game enough!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Masterpiece
customer_reviews.text: It’s probably the best game on ps4 so far. It’s a departure from the previous GoW games, but for the better.
customer_reviews.author: Wesley

customer_reviews.title: The opening scene was enough for me to know that this was going to be an amazing journey that I was thrilled to get into
customer_reviews.text: I've been a God of War fan for many years. So when this came out, I nearly lost it. The opening scene was enough for me to know that this was going to be an amazing journey that I was thrilled to get into. I've gotten pretty distracted by side quests, but is that really a bad thing? The side quests have helped flesh out Kratos and Atreus in great ways, providing more detail to the world they're in, without feeling like simple fetch quests that are only used for experience.
customer_reviews.author: Shayla Baldwin

customer_reviews.title: A Sleeper Hit
customer_reviews.text: I have never enjoyed a God of War game. This is quite possibly one of the best games ever made. It is long, it is challenging in a fair and honest way, and the plot is expertly crafted. The controls are decent and easy to manage, and rewarding if you learn how the different combos can work. I am waiting for a sequel.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Smartt

customer_reviews.title: My Favorite Franchise of All Time
customer_reviews.text: My all-time favorite game is back and better than ever! I've loved this game since I first played it in the PS2 days but I admit as a creature of habit I was somewhat skeptical about how the Norse storyline along with the Kratos having a companion within gameplay would turnout. I'm glad to say that I was not disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: D-GIL

customer_reviews.title: Love GOW
customer_reviews.text: The graphics are awesome, there is a new game+ that keeps all your saved skill upgrades and armor. There is even new armor as well. I think there is a special type of armor once you defeat some of the valkaries as well. I cannot wait for the next GOW to come out!
customer_reviews.author: Manda

customer_reviews.text: This was one of my favorite games I played this year. The combat is fast paced and fun. It’s not like the previous God of Wars in that it’s not on rails, but I think this new formula is great.
customer_reviews.author: toledos

customer_reviews.title: Incredible game with tons of content...
customer_reviews.text: Really enjoyed this game from beginning to end. The amount of exploration and content can get a little overwhelming at times. The voice acting, story, atmosphere, character development were all excellent. The game play was very fun and the end game is very challenging. I've never 100% completed a game yet on ps4 but I am currently working on it with this 1 and like 74% there. Definitely worth the purchase if you like Norse mythology and God of War games.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Must buy game! Amazing
customer_reviews.text: AMAZING!!! Awesom game! One of the best games I have ever played. And I've been gaming for over 20 years. Amazing graphics, sound, gameplay and story. Cant wait until they make a sequel.
customer_reviews.author: Alvin P.

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT!
customer_reviews.text: Hope they make a sequel to this game, way more to see in this universe, if you loved the God of Wars from the past, this is worlds better, sorry die hards, but this is amazing! Can you say PS5 God of War II, yes please.
customer_reviews.author: Jason M.

customer_reviews.title: Boy, oh BOY!
customer_reviews.text: I am hooked. Absolutely hooked. Looks and performs great in 4K. Story pacing is phenomenal. Humor is subtle but entertaining and makes for some great memes. Really emotional and cinematic experience. The new combat is nearly perfect. The world is open, but not too open and really feels like it rewards you for exploring.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Misleading product
customer_reviews.text: Was looking forward to popping the disc in and playing on arrival, as we do not have household internet. However, instead of sending the physical game, I received an expired game code on a piece of paper. If I wanted a digital copy of the game, I'd buy it and immediately download it, not wait a week for shipping...
customer_reviews.author: Alex

product_meta.title: God of War - Playstation 4
product_meta.description:
From Santa Monica Studio and creative director Cory Barlog comes a new beginning for one of gaming’s most recognizable icons. Living as a man outside the shadow of the gods, Kratos must adapt to unfamiliar lands, unexpected threats, and a second chance at being a father. Together with his son Atreus, the pair will venture into the brutal Norse wilds and fight to fulfill a deeply personal quest. 
• Bold New Beginning — His vengeance against the Gods of Olympus years behind him, Kratos now lives as a man in the realm of Norse Gods and monsters. It is in this harsh, unforgiving world that he must fight to survive…And teach his son to do the same. This startling reimagining of God of War deconstructs the core elements that defined the series—satisfying combat; breathtaking scale; and a powerful narrative—and fuses them anew. 
• A Second Chance — Kratos is a father again. As mentor and protector to Atreus, a son determined to earn his respect, he is forced to deal with and control the rage that has long defined him while out in a very dangerous world with his son. 
• A Darker, More Elemental World — From the marble and columns of ornate Olympus to the gritty forests, mountains, and caves of Pre Viking Norse lore, this is a distinctly new realm with its own pantheon of creatures, monsters, and gods. With an added emphasis on discovery and exploration, the world will draw players in to explore every inch of God of War’s breathtakingly threatening landscape—by far the largest in the franchise. 
• Vicious, Physical Combat — With an over the shoulder free camera that brings the player closer to the action than ever before, fights in God of War mirror the pantheon of Norse creatures Kratos will face: grand, gritty, and grueling. A new main weapon and new abilities retain the defining spirit of God of War while presenting a vision of violent conflict that forges new ground in the genre. Mature 17 plus.
feature_bullets: A New Beginning: His vengeance against the gods of Olympus far behind him, Kratos now lives as a man in the lands of Norse Gods and monsters. It is in this harsh, unforgiving world that he must fight to survive and teach his son to do the same

Second Chances: As mentor and protector to a son determined to earn his respect, Kratos is faced with an unexpected opportunity to master the rage that has long defined him. Questioning the dark lineage he’s passed on to his son, he hopes to make amends for the shortcomings of his past; Number of Players: 1 player; ESRB Content: Blood and gore|Intense violence|Strong language; Genre: Action / Adventure
Midgard and Beyond: Set within the untamed forests, mountains, and realms of Norse lore, God of War features a distinctly new setting with its own pantheon of creatures, monsters, and gods

Vicious, Physical Combat, with an intimate, over the shoulder free camera that brings the action closer than ever, combat in God of War is up close, frenetic, and unflinching. Kratos’ axe: powerful, magic and multi faceted is a brutal weapon as well as a versatile tool for exploration
